title.rendered: How Do I Get A Lobbying Internship?

content.rendered:
Passionate about government policies and want to work towards changing them? If yes, then you might be interested in getting valuable experience via a lobbying internship. 

What does a lobbying intern do?

Lobbying interns work under professional Lobbyists that are working to influence certain political decisions on behalf of their clients. Lobbying interns are concerned with researching and writing briefs, communicating with clients, and supporting their firm during projects in various other ways.

How do I find a lobbying internship?

If you’re wondering how to get a lobbying internship for summer 2021, try looking on Handshake under filtered searches like “lobbying internships near me.” Handshake allows you to focus on employers you want to work for and even network with past interns who may also be alumni from your school. And if you’re looking for a lobbying internship in a particular location for summer 2021, try searching for openings by using filters like “lobbying firms DC internships” or “lobbying internships summer 2021.”

How do I get a lobbying internship with no experience?

If you’re interested in getting a lobbying internship, but have no prior experience, it’s key to play to your strengths and show employers that you’re eager to learn. You can search for lobbying internships on Handshake to first get a feel of the requirements they usually list for internships. After that, list your resume and cover letter experiences and previous roles you’ve had where the skills translate over. For example, if you’ve taken a government related course or have had experience volunteering for a non-profit, mention it and how it relates to your desired role! 

When should I start applying for lobbying internships?

For most positions, start searching for your internship sooner rather than later! If you are planning to have a summer lobbying internship, we recommend starting to look for internship positions no later than the season prior. Many industries prefer to recruit as early as the fall, so staying up to date on fall virtual career fairs will be helpful in securing a role! Each company has different deadlines for applications, so sooner is usually better! If you’re searching for a role during the school year, it’s best to get on applying 3-6 months prior so you can inform your internship of your other obligations and classes.

It’s also really important to keep in mind that your university’s career services center will have great insight about specific recruitment periods at your school. Make sure to sign up for a meeting with your career advisor at the start of the school year for additional help in planning ahead!

How much do lobbying interns make?

Because the internship roles that require lobbying interns vary, there’s no standard answer for a lobbying internship payscale. If you’re wondering how much your internship will pay, it might be best to inquire directly with the company you’re considering taking an internship with.. Some internship programs will offer only class credits, while many others are more keen to compensate their interns with an hourly rate or a set stipend.

What skills are relevant for lobbying interns?

  • Strong public speaking skills
  • Good research and analytics skills
  • Ability to work both alone and in a team setting

Where do lobbying interns work?

Lobbying interns can take their learnings and work into a few different roles like Public Policy Advocates, Lawyers, and Law Clerks. They also can work for many different types of companies, like our constantly growing list of employers hiring now.

How do I write a cover letter for an internship?

Take a look at some great cover letter writing tips to boost your confidence and ace your internship application! And if you need a place to start, try our free cover letter template download here, or reach out to your school’s career center for personalized cover letter guidance.
